datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to celestial observations, ancient star maps, and early astronomical practices.

columns.name: civilization_name
columns.description: Name of the ancient civilization

columns.name: star_map_detail_level
columns.description: Detail level of star maps, rated from 10 to 100 with higher values indicating greater details

columns.name: advanced_metallurgy
columns.description: Indicates if the civilization had access to advanced metallurgical techniques

columns.name: trade_activity_level
columns.description: Numeric score representing the level of trade activity, where higher values indicate greater activity

columns.name: number_of_clear_nights_per_year
columns.description: The total number of nights per year that experience clear skies, conducive for astronomical observations.

columns.name: latitude
columns.description: The average latitude of the predominant area of the civilization

columns.name: binary_star_usage
columns.description: Percentage of navigational practices involving binary star systems

columns.name: star_map_complexity
columns.description: Complexity rating of the star maps used on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: star_charts_documented_percentile
columns.description: Percentile ranking of civilizations based on the number of documented star charts

columns.name: single_star_usage
columns.description: Percentage of navigational practices using single stars

columns.name: celestial_navigation
columns.description: Indicates if the civilization used stars for navigation

columns.name: frequency_of_clear_skies
columns.description: Measure of how often the sky is clear, on a scale from 1 (rare) to 10 (frequent).

columns.name: metallic_ore_deposits
columns.description: Indicates the presence of significant metallic ore deposits in the region

columns.name: technological_advancement_level
columns.description: Rating of technological advancements of the civilization on a scale from 1 to 5

columns.name: star_chart_references
columns.description: Number of star charts created by the civilization

columns.name: advanced_calendar_systems
columns.description: Indicates if the civilization has a sophisticated system for tracking time based on celestial events

columns.name: comet_sightings
columns.description: Number of comet sightings per century recorded by the civilization

columns.name: seasonal_light_pollution_variation
columns.description: The degree of change in light pollution throughout different seasons, where higher values indicate greater variability.

columns.name: lunar_phase_records
columns.description: Number of documented lunar phases per century

columns.name: percentage_of_ancient_observatories
columns.description: The percentage of land area that contains ancient astronomical observatories.

columns.name: astronomic_seasons_utilized
columns.description: Number of seasons in which the civilization made significant celestial observations

queries.question: What is the relationship between technological advancement level, frequency of clear skies, seasonal light pollution variation, and the usage of single star systems in ancient civilizations related to astronomy?
queries.true_hypothesis: Civilizations with higher technological advancements and better nighttime visibility, as well as a moderate to high frequency of clear skies and low to moderate seasonal light pollution variation, are more likely to use single star systems for navigation.
